definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: We, the Chinese people, have our national self-respect and pride.
sentences.chinese: 中國人民有自己的民族自尊心和自豪感。

sentences.english: The proud look on my 4-year-old son’s face when he learns a new skill.
sentences.chinese: 4歲兒子學會新把戲時的，他臉上的自豪感。

sentences.english: Eight hundred million Africans would get a tremendous boost to their self-esteem and cultural pride.
sentences.chinese: 8億非洲人將大大增強他們的自尊和文化自豪感。

sentences.english: How do you instill pride and resilience in her?
sentences.chinese: 你怎樣逐步幫她樹立自豪感和適應能力呢？

sentences.english: China is also being driven by national pride.
sentences.chinese: 中國此舉也是受到了民族自豪感的驅策。

sentences.english: With a sense of great pride I knocked the last nail in.
sentences.chinese: 我懷着自豪感，把最後一個釘子釘了進去。

sentences.english: Now it's a point of pride in a weird way.
sentences.chinese: 現在行爲怪異反倒讓人有種莫名其妙的自豪感。

sentences.english: The grand building polarizes a deep local pride.
sentences.chinese: 這座宏偉的建築集中體現了當地人深切的自豪感。

sentences.english: Her original vigorous pride of youth had sickened.
sentences.chinese: 她原先那種生氣勃勃的青春自豪感已經萎謝。

sentences.english: Westies have a lot of pride.
Stream restoration projects create great sense of pride amongst residents.
sentences.chinese: 河流恢復項目能建立居民強烈的自豪感。

sentences.english: But having any sort of ocean-going capability is good for national pride.
sentences.chinese: 只要擁有任何程度上遠航能力都可以提升民族自豪感。

sentences.english: A FIERCE pride in one’s regional roots can be found throughout England.
sentences.chinese: 整個英國人們可以發現一種地源性的強烈自豪感。

sentences.english: He had a spasm of doubtful pride .
sentences.chinese: 他體驗了一陣不塌實的自豪感。

sentences.english: He has restored stability and a sense of pride among citizens.
sentences.chinese: 他恢復了穩定的局面，重新喚起了民衆的自豪感。

sentences.english: being a leader for your family.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一家之主的自豪感。

definition: arising involuntarily (idiom); spontaneous/to spring up unbidden (of emotion)
